name: Richard L White
text: Out of business I guess

name: Dennis Helms
text: Came from Jasper after seeing Fox 6 Fred Hunter show.  I was hoping to meet Paul and hear his story.  Anyway I get there around 10:30 AM to find no one.

name: Mary Evans
text: I was so excited to find a shoe repair shoppe in Montgomery, Alabama. Conveniently located at Eastdale Mall at the movie theater entrance. Courteous owner and repairs done well!

name: Sylvester James
text: They do great work

name: Alexis White
text: Very quick friendly and professional ..... have had  all  shoe repair work done here but also battery replacement and will take out links for watches and minor jewelry repair .. Highly recommend

name: Annie Park
text: Excellent work.Speedy and timely service.i have taken my boots and a heel that was badly worn but they made it look almost like new pairs. I was very happy at their work. Price is resonable. I go to this place because  it is very convenient to get other services done at the same place.  They do watch repairs and jewelry repairs as well. It is like one stop service. It is very convenient. I highly recommend this place.

name: Krista Hawkins
text: Hi. My name is Krista.  I just wanted to say that Happy Feet keeps my my feet happy!!  I have been using Happy Feet for all of my shoe repair needs for years and I have been satisfied each time.  The owners are extremely nice and friendly, the service is exceptional and the repair turn around time is more than fair.  I have used them for jewelry repair as well. If it can be fixed Happy Feet will fix it.  I've been doing business with them for so long that that feel like family.   As long as they are open, I will always take my business and refer others to HAPPY FEET!!!

name: Carol Roberts
text: For years I went here to have the heels of my more expensive shoes repaired. My high heels would have pads on the bottom that would wear over time and expose the screw, so I would like when I walked. They were friendly, did fast work, and have very reasonable prices.

name: Willie Armstead
text: It was ok

name: Melissa Bates
text: The ONLY place my family and I trust to have our shoes repairs taken care of! Great service!

name: shelby jones
text: They did an awesome job on repairing my boots. Even had them ready ahead of the scheduled pick-up time.

name: Miriam Molloy
text: Very pleased with the service and price here. I've brought two pair of high heels here and they re-birthed them both times.

name: shugah sosweet
text: I WAS WALKING BY SAW A CUTE NECKLACE FOR MY SON DECIDED TO PURCHASE AFTER SHE STATED IT WAS 19.99. WHEN THE NOTIFICATION POPPED UP SHE CHARGED MY CARD 43.99 THEY ARE SOME THIEVES. WILL NOT EVER DO BUSINESS WITH THEM.

name: Lauren Luke
text: Service was fast, friendly, and my shoes look brand new!

name: Theron G
text: Rip off. If you can get through the language barrier.  ( Good luck} Charged a hundred bucks to put on a shoe lift for me. Ok  maybe my instructions were wrong but the lift needed to be lowered. Went back and he wanted like seventy more dollars to lower the lift. Go to Cloverdale shoe repair or the shoe place on Atlanta HWY Nice English speaking folks .  Cloverdale lowered a shoe I got wrong for free. I's just a little labor for this.Prejudice hell yeah. I do not like thieves. Just deal. Had to give them a star. Not deserved

name: Ronald Smith
text: Always dose great job I give them five stars

name: Bre McGhee
text: Have a shoulder bag that needed a screw for the handle. A SMALL screw that looks like it can go in your eyeglasses. She says it’ll be $35. The same screws are on Amazon for $8. Crooks

name: Eric Trahan
text: Took 15 minutes to make my wedge for my shoe. That's only because of the great conversation we were having. First choice for future shoe repair!

name: Blessed Mommies
text: This guy is awesome and nice, he is reasonable. Highly recommend this place.

name: Tami Haynes
text: I have a pair of boots that belonged to my grandmother that needed to be restitched. I just happened to pass this place on my way to get some orange rolls at All Steak and thought I'd stop by to see if anything could be done. He basically told me that he couldn't make any promises but he would certainly try. I completely understood because they were pretty badly torn. I was so surprised by the outstanding job he was able to do! I don't remember the cost but I do remember it was less than $5 and I thought to myself,  "how is this man gonna stay in business charging pennies for this phenomenal service?" But I guess enough people have found this little gem and he's stayed open. I am truly happy with his work.

name: Matt Kinsland
text: Just got my cowboy boots back. They look like new. Friendly people that provide quality craftsmanship at a VERY reasonable price.

resp.text: Thanks for the review! Always happy to provide the best service to the best customers.

name: Kami Drake
text: I bring all of my leather shoes to Mr Briscoe for sole protectors and repairs! Great work and quality service!

name: Matt T
text: Excellent craftsmanship and fast friendly service. You can't ask for much more than that. Highly recommended.

resp.text: Thanks for taking the time to write a review. We're happy to give you the best service in town. Tell your friends!

name: Jake Ridgeway
text: I had a great experience.  The bottom of my boots needed fixed, plus they were worn looking as well. I was thrilled with the finished look, the quality of the replacement parts, how new my boots looked when I picked them up. Definitely my go to place for repairs.

name: Stephanie Smith
text: Great service, my shoes were ready very quickly about a wk. They look wonderful, great job!!

name: Courtney Pollard
text: Come check it out! He fixes purses, wallets, belts, boots, definitely worth stopping in.

name: Jessica Cline
text: The Cobbler Shoppe has moved to Boaz! Just a short 20 minute drive from Gadsden. The Shop is spacious with plenty of parking. This owner knows his stuff! Please support your local businesses. Keep this tradition alive!

name: Amy Adkins
text: Excellent shoe repair and reasonable prices! Only place l would recommend.

name: Romara Ahallow
text:
Quality work for respectable prices done quickly.

Couldn't ask for more.

name: Patrick Dreher
text: Been going here for years. Very fair, honest, and quality shoe repair store! Highly recommend

name: Brandi O'Neal
text: Great work

name: Kathy Stanley
text: He did an awesome job on my ankle boots. I've had other work done there and it's my go to place for repairs and modifications to shoes.

name: Will Slappey
text: Very nice couple runs this shop. They did a great job on my shoes and ended up costing less than I expected. Definitely will use them again!

name: Carol Dowdy
text: We’ve been going for years with all types of shoes and boots for men and women. The best!

name: Martha Ledbetter
text: Great work at a reasonable price - the owners are always friendly and helpful,

name: Ross U
text: Had multiple shoes repaired here and leather soles replaced. They have tons of shoe accessories. I needed tongue pads and heel pads for a pair of shoes once and they had plenty readily available and they have stayed on much longer than another place I got them.

name: gary fenton
text: Great service with friendly and positive folks

name: Kathy Scott
text: Have had several shoes repaired and the owner has done a great job and is always very courteous.

name: Margie McClenny
text: They are very helpful and always do a good job.

name: Raleigh Bates
text: Good service, excellent work

name: Avien Bost
text: AMAZING shoe cobbler. Not many left in this trade! Support small business, support trade careers!! Look at the life he gave back to our son's size 16 work boots!! Highly recommend!

name: Peggy Leverett
text: Mr Dobbs did a great job sewing up a gun holster for my son. Very knowledgeable and professional. Good price!! It's an 80 mile drive round trip but well worth it for good service!! Thank you, Mike!

name: Kayla Lowery-Busick
text: Mike's work is flawless, he's friendly and helpful. He repairs shoes, bags, and belts. I've been going there fifteen years and I wouldn't go anywhere else. Thanks Mike!

name: David Lyle
text: One of the few cobblers left in the state. If they can't fix your leather goods, they ain't broke.

name: David Harris
text:
Apparently no longer in business.
Phone out of service. Doors locked.

name: Simple People
text:
Came here 3 times in the last 4 days no one their no note no signs nothing no 1 answers the phone.
I think they went
Out of-Business.

1

name: vkutz
text: The only shoe repair worth using. The gentleman and his mother do absolutely beautiful work. They are true craftspeople. I take all my shoe and owe leather repair to them. Outstanding work and very reasonably priced! Love this shoe repair!!!

name: Larry Blackburn
text: Closed needs to be taken off google

name: David K
text: Brought by my worn down dress shoes to have the heels replaced and actually stood in line to wait my turn as this place was so popular during the lunch hour.  I was delighted by the casual and comfortable manner in which the cobbler asked me about my preferences.  The work was done in mere days and saved me from having to purchase a new pair of shoes all for a fraction of the potential new shoe cost.  Highly recommend this locale to anyone wanting to save some real shoe dollars.

name: Ginger Knipe
text: Awesome service and an interesting place to look around.  Repaired my favorite purse for 5 dollars.

name: Richard McClure
text: Anyone that knows me understand I’m very picky about my boots I have dress boots from the 1970s Luchesse too Dan Post I drive 60 miles because no one touches my boots but Mr Dobbs.     Thank You

name: Julie Pitts
text: Quality repairs are guaranteed. Being a cobbler is a long tradition for this family owned business. Prices have been raised in the recent past but to save a pair of beloved footwear it is still the place to go to have quality repairs done. Many people from surrounding areas make the drive just to come to this shop.

name: Matt C
text: We have no shoe shop in Florence.  It is well worth the drive over to Athens for the service they provide.  They do great work and very reasonable price.

name: Beatriz Hill
text: Great service.   Father and son run shop.  They both are very personable and helpful.  Shoe repair shops are few in numbers and this one will definitely get my repeat business.

name: H Logan
text: Good service. Fine work. Hope they are around a long time. Need more shoe service shops like this.

name: Sean Busick
text: They do amazing work at Dobbs Shoe Shop. They've repaired and re-soled shoes and boots for me, repaired leather bags, resized belts, etc.  I have never been unhappy with their work. They are courteous, they provide prompt service, and their prices are always reasonable.

name: D Meyer
text: Does great work.  New soles, heels, reconditioning, polishing.  Very friendly.

name: Marsha Galloway
text: Three generation family owned business. Very nice friendly people. Very reasonable pricing. Excellent repair work.

name: Ken Bond
text: Just picked up my Boulet boots. Had new soles and heels put on. Totally impressed with the quality. These men truly take pride in their work !! Will be recommending them to everyone I know !!

name: Marry Staggs
text: He fixes shoes good.

name: Jim Leyden
text: I have absolute confidence in their abilities and the pricing is really economical.

name: Don Prater
text: Awesome work and great prices

name: Evan Garner
text: After struggling to find a good cobbler in the area, someone recommended Dobbs. Great job. Very happy. Will continue to take my shoes there for repair.

name: William Flood
text: Convenient and friendly

name: Rodney Hopkins
text: Awsome place fixed my boots think I can get 5 more years out of em again.

name: Cassie Mcmurtrey
text: They didn't have my boots ready, they had lost them, when they found them after 2 weeks they didn't even fix them right. They come apart after 3 days

name: Mary Lewis
text: A great place to get your shoes repaired

name: judith rausch
text: Indeed,  excellent repair service.  We drive a long distance as well for Dobbs work.  TY Dobb’s!

name: Timothy Brick
text: Great job

name: Hartselle VeteransOutreach
text: Mike is truly a craftsman, superior work

name: Sandra Keil
text: Always Consistent, Great Prices!

name: Benjamin Guthrie
text: It is a good shop to go to.

name: Leon Steele
text: Great service

name: C Meyer
text: Does great work. Honest and dependable.

name: Dewayne Bowie
text: I love to support  small businesses

name: Amber porter
text: Oldest store in athens al

name: Maggie Wright
text: Good

name: Cynthia Adams
text: Fast, excellent service!

name: Ray Ragland
text: I went to have my wifes sandals repaired he was very helpful with the info to get them repaired as he could  not get to them at this time I appreciate  his patience  with trying to help me get the sandals fixed

name: Bama Bears Newfoundlands
text: Nice nan, good job. Heal repair.

name: kay williams
text: Mr JIM was wonderful! He did a great job with a smile

name: Kent Long
text: He did a great job...has a great personality... and price was good. I was very well pleased.

name: Tim “Whoops” Doran
text: I have found a new best friend at Evans Awning glad to say I know them

name: Danny Minor
text:
Went there on 1-20-2021, arrived at 9:15 a.m.    Open sign was lit up.  Sign on the door said they opend at 9.     Door was locked.
I stood at door holding my boots, knocked but was ignored.  Someone was inside but they just looked at me.
I was wearing an N95 mask.
I guess they didnt like how I looked.
I will try to sew the damaged boot myself.
The shoe repair shops of old are long gone.

name: Helachaos Wallace
text: This is the greatest small show repair shop the most affordable the most friendly down to earth man I have met in long time. And honest too

name: Mitchell Summerlin
text: They didn't open at all when I went on Monday, though their sign said they were open and several people were waiting to get in.  Nor did they answer their phone.  On Tuesday morning  they weren't open and didn't answer the phone.  Finally they answered the phone after lunch and said they were open and had been open both days.  No way I'm going to leave my four pairs of shoes there.  Don't know when I would get them back.

name: Myra Aldridge
text: I highly recommend  Decatur Shoe Repair.

name: Jerry Shumake
text: Had a small job and it was done same day

name: Malinda Dillard
text: Nice man, but botched my boots.  Unwearable as is, sole glue already coming apart because no sewing was done.  Glue spot on the suede ruined the suede.

name: Beth Duncan
text: Absolutely the best shoe repair place ever!  If you need something ASAP,  I suggest waiting around and tipping well.🙂

name: Donna Smith
text: We have taken several pair of shoes,  a couple of purses, belts,  here and we are always satisfied with the work.

name: alice mockensturm
text: Sweet man but did a poor job on my husband's dress shoes.  Pretty sure he will never wear them again.

name: Wes Duncan
text: Took a pair of boots and a pair of tennis shoes. Boots weren’t even cleaned just shined, tennis shoes aren’t even wearable. They used white paint on the trim of the tennis shoe which doesn’t match. Waste of money and time. 0 out of 10.

name: S Thrash
text: Could not get my leather bracelet back after several attempts to do so.  It has now been 6 months.

name: Amel Drake
text: Great place to get your shoes shined!

name: Cassandra Poole
text: Great professional service!

name: DeWana Bowling
text: Wonderful owner!

name: Alan Gastler
text: Never answered the phone after repeated calls at, all at different times in the day.

name: Hellen Wallace
text: The prices are reasonable

name: Greg Mattson
text: friendly employees excellent work

name: Zoe Wirt
text:
Easy interaction, high quality work.

I had my fiancé’s shoes re-heeled and polished for $45. I brought them in Friday and they were ready to be picked up Monday. Straightforward, great experience

name: David White
text: A smug 40-something millenial-wanna-be informed me that repairing my shoes would cost $75 for top soles and that it would probably not be worth it since they were "only" $100 shoes.  Well, guess what bro-mancing the stone?  Your nearest competitor (Homewood Shoe Hospital) repaired my shoes for $40 and they put a nice shine on them for free!  Good luck with your customer service and business model!

resp.text:
I am sorry that you feel the way that you do about my “business model” Mr. David White.

In your rant you stated that I told you that it would be $75 for “Top Soles”, which is what Homewood Shoe Hospital obviously did to your shoes looking at the photo that you provide.  I quoted you $75 for “REAL Soles” AND “ REAL Heels”, which you DID NOT GET at your new favorite shoe shop. You have HOLES in your shoes Mr. White.  Placing a $1 piece of thin rubber “aka Top Sole” over a hole in someone’s shoes to hide it, is not how I fix shoes.  It also is not in my “business model”.

I was upfront with you, just like I am with all of my customers because the repair cost was equal to the what you paid for your shoes when you bought them.  I will continue to be this way, despite being slapped in the face for it by people who don’t seem to know any better.  Thanks for trying my shop first. However, it will be better for us both if you continue to be a Homewood Shoe Hospital Customer.

Best regards,
Louis

name: Dwight Hallmark
text: Reasonable price and very personable, my boots look like new, I will be back

name: Brad Key
text: I walked in and asked if he could do a shoe shine, while I waited. I explained that I was on my way to my mother's funeral. He took the shoes back and gave them a great shine. I asked how much the shine cost. He said no charge and offered his condolences  I told him that I wanted to pay for the shoe shine but he said no sir. It is amazing how big of a difference a small act of kindness can make in a person's life. I will always be grateful and give him business every chance that I get.

name: Megan Brasher
text: Extremely friendly and honest. I stopped in before Christmas because the heel of my boot came off. He said he was 3 weeks out but quickly fixed them back in place to get me through the holiday. I'll bring them back soon and any other shoes or boots that need help.

name: David Khoury
text: Excellent 👍. Knowledgeable! Honest!!

name: Jay J
text: Called just for advice on better quality shoes vs comfortable shoes and was given free great advice. Greatly appreciated, if I needed shoe repair I would go here just for that level of customer service.

name: G Gg
text:
Incredibly rude and condescending. Would not fix my shoes because he said he did not enjoy doing that particular fix. I highly recommend Homewood Shoe Hospital as an alternative.

In response to your response: First of all, who reads and responds to their own Google reviews? You're obviously not new to bad reviews. You're also misquoting yourself and misunderstanding your job. You unprofessionally laughed in my face and made me have to ask if you were going to fix my shoes or not. It's not your job to tell people if their shoes are worth your time. The shoes I brought to you were actually made in this country (Frye), had barely been worn, and have sentimental value to me. They're currently being mended elsewhere to my satisfaction. If you do not do "patch jobs" or "substandard work" then maybe consider a more professional approach to declining people needing quick fixes that you do not want to do. It may also be wise to consider that people are coming to you for a service for something they'd like for you to preserve instead of judge. Those shoes belonged to my mother that recently passed away and now they are tarnished with a bad memory of your unprofessionalism. Thank you for that.

resp.text: No Mr. G Gg.  I said  "I do not enjoy doing that particular repair, KNOWING THAT THE SHOE WILL PROBABLY FALL APART ON YOU LATER". You didn't finish the sentence.  Lately it seems, that when I try to stop someone from throwing their hard earned money away, they go write something bad about me on forums like this after I've tried to help them. Unfortunately in 2018, I have to tell quite a few people a day that their shoes aren't worth the cost of the repair or can't be repaired at all.  It wasn't like this in 1986 when I first opened my shop.  Most everything was made in our own country and constructed well enough to be repaired. This is no longer the case.  I do not do patch jobs or substandard work.  I either repair it correctly or I don't repair it at all.

name: lbjewels Brasseale
text: The owner is great and will be honest with you...He will tell you if your shoes are worth repairing....I like being told the truth no matter what.....That he will do !!!

name: sloan dixon
text: I have had both wonderful, and one lackluster experience, at this shoe repair shop. I still give him 5 stars because he has repaired my shoes in very timely and fair priced manner, when in a huge pinch where I needed the shoes. I noticed, most recently, that he is not taking new repairs, to catch up on his overwhelming amount of business, due to lack of help in the shop. He did take my repairs, after some sweet talk. Both, Upside Down Shoe Repair and Homewood Shoe Hospital, are the last of a dying art and a much needed service. They both have been very kind and wonderful service to have around, due to the fact that I am very hard on my shoes, and have invested in a few very nice pairs to get me through work and play. Kudos to the art of shoe repairs and 2 local businesses that step up the plate, when things aren't made as well as they used to be crafted. Way to put the best foot forward!

name: Heiress
text: I let the Hoover Shoe Repair (Chapel Hill Road) put a new sole on a pair of $300 boots.  They charged approximately $80 (in advance of the work).  They did an awful job, did not stand behind their work, and had a bad attitude when I called about correcting the problem.  Upside Down Shoe Repair did an excellent job in fixing my shoes and for a lot less!  I would recommend them to anyone!

name: Sc German
text: Very nice and personable, honest and up-front about the timeline, and did an excellent job re-soling my Louboutins. Definitely would recommend.

name: Estelle Crouch
text: Good service

name: Sinead Maher
text: Always happy with the work done here

name: Bob Apol
text: Always very satisfied with the work

name: Kenneth Johnson
text: I found a rather new pair of real leather shoes and they repaired my mom shoes while I waited and did a great job. Very reasonable and fast nice people.

name: Deborah Gordon
text: The owner did a very good job repairing my luggage.

name: Curtis Jones
text: Do not hate this place.

name: Don Thomas
text: Great place to take your shoes the owner really nice guy

name: Eric Shugart
text: What a fantastic experience. Very pleasant and repaired a gash that I thought was not repairable. In addition, I had a pair of boots with a rubber edge I didn't wear because of the wear. After about 45 seconds, the entire boot looked brand new. Going forward, they will be doing all of mine and my wife's show polishing and repair. Highly recommend to anyone with realistic expectations around shoe repair and or patch services.

name: Sarah Ramdeen
text: I wish I had thought to take before pictures of my boots. They look amazing now that the repairs are completed. I brought in two pairs of boots and the craftmanship on both are incredible. They look like new.

name: Jessica Cost
text:
THREE MONTHS ago, I took a pair of boots in for stretching. Still haven't gotten them back. I called about 6 weeks ago to check on them and the lady on the phone was very condescending and short. So, by the time I'll be getting them back, it will be too hot to wear them. IF I get them back...who knows at this point?! Save your time, folks. Go somewhere else.

Also, their showroom is disgusting. The whole place reeked of cigarettes and it's just a disheveled mess. Guess my boots will smell like smoke, too. Ugh.

name: Kirk Ward
text: I just don't see what the problem is.  The owner is very professorial, does a quality job and if you ask his opinion on something, be prepared for the answer.............whether you like it or not.  On this visit, her repaired a cut on the side of one of my boots and then did a really good job of cleaning them up without changing the color.  All at a more than fair price.  I will keep going back for as long as he is open.

name: Elli Maye
text: I brought in a pair of brand new shoes that needed a little sewing on a stitch for reinforcement. The repair work was shotty with threads hanging off and the stitch came out while I was still in the parking lot. I went back in, showed the lady, and she offered to try again, but with a trip coming up, there was no time for that. She did give me a full refund. It would've been nice to have the work done right the first time. The stitching was not the worst of it though. The smell of the business is of pure cigarette smoke. I was unable to get the smell out of my shoes and I ended up donating them. I don't understand why this hasn't been mentioned in any of the reviews. Word of caution: If you walk in and there is smoke hanging in the air, your items will smell like that and it won't come out.

name: Cody Mac
text: I've taken some custom leather shoes in multiple times for repairs (heavy wear and tear), and they always do a great job for me, at a reasonable price. If you need any shoe repair, or custom footwear repaired, definitely check them out!

name: Patti Jean
text: Not a place I would recommend. I've been several times and each time the service is poor, they only take cash. Price changes from drop off date. Mediocre  at best.

name: Jerry Barclay
text: Highly recommended!  I needed a pair of dress shoes resoled, and needed them done quickly.  The owner gave me a quick turn-around date, had the shoes ready when promised, did very nice work and charged a very reasonable price.  I won't go anywhere else.

name: hannah vaughn
text: Honestly this guy is a joke and very unprofessional. We went in to get patches sewn onto our vests. He insulted another shops previous work, was disrespectful about our organization, and laughed and said he didn’t want future business if we had any, but he’d “be happy” to do the work we needed (he obviously was not excited about bringing him business). On top of all that, he said it would take a week to get the work done and scolded me for not asking about how long it would take over the phone? He couldn’t quote me a price over the phone so why would I ask about how long it would take if he “has to see the patches in person first”? We went to JT’s shoe repair and they had it done in an hour with exceptional quality and was nice as could be. Don’t waste your time with this guy, go to JT’s.

name: Joseph Gibson
text: Good prices and great service. He is honest and does not try to trick you into buying anything. He gets the job done.

name: Ben Nemec
text: Fantastic service. He'll shine, repair, and even recommend shoe brands based on his extensive experience in the industry.  Would highly recommend.

name: Hegan Belue
text: I had shoes polished and repaired.  Good work and reasonable pricing.  The man at the counter was very nice to do business with.

name: Ben McDaniel
text: They did a great job on a pair of shoes that I thought were ruined. They are super helpful and I would definitely recommend them to anyone!

name: David & Lisa McCord
text: Brady's Shoe Repair is awesome!  Steve is very friendly and does excellent work.  Reasonable prices, quick turn-around time, and shoes that look like new again.

name: Bonnie Harrison
text: We have had our shoes repaired there for many years and he has always done an excellent job. We highly recommend him.

name: Dave Root
text: My mother broke my wife's favorite sandles.  Took them to Brady and he fixed them on the spot! Great service! I'll be going back!

name: soylent green
text: always helpful and offers only the service i need, nothing that i dont need. bradys resoles both my work boots and my dress shoes and the work has always been done beyond my satisfaction. a plus is that the shoes are always returned looking better than when i dropped them off. i always recommend bradys.

name: Farley Church Of Christ
text: BRADY HAS RETIRED.  BUSINESS IS CLOSED.

name: Sharp Shinerz
text: If I could rate a absolute zero then I would . Had my boots for almost 4 months and every time I called he said it would be the next week . He was very rude over the phone and blamed the store that sent them to him for me as to why it was taking so long . Went in and they still was not done after . The boots had not even been touched . He was very rude and disrespectful. He said he told us not to come in till they was done . That the boot store that sent them to him was lying and he had not had them but a little while , but the boot store has receipt for when they mailed it and when he got them . A 2 week job turned into 4 months of nothing. He is a liar , unorganized, rude, disrespectful, and unprofessional. I nor the boot store I used will be using him again .

name: Barbara Lee Norris
text: Excellent repair of three pair of shoes. Highly recommend.

name: Katie Carpenter Stuhr
text: The cobbler I recommend to all my friends...and you too.

name: Lolita Jones
text: Great place to take shoes for repair.

name: Ric Patterson
text: very pleased with his  work.....would recommend to anyone

name: Bill Allen
text: They do a great job on shoes and boots. They do a horrible job of seeing patches to leather jackets/vests.

name: Dana Dunne
text: He insinuated my purse was cheap and that he could not repair it. Very rude.

name: DJ Sam Smite
text: Not done with excellence in mind. One should never have to pay for a repair and then be suggested to have to take it home to complete the repair with a touch up job. Counter productive.

name: Amber Bianchini
text: The repair was poorly done, expensive ($20 for stitching and glue on soles), and new damage was done to my shoes.  When I asked about the new damage, I was treated extremely badly.  I will not be returning.

name: Charlene Coburn
text: The people are excellent craftsmen in their field of work with decades of family taught, hands-on experience in leather repair and and refurbishing of any type of leather goods from shoes, purses, travel bags, etc. The care they give to preserve the original integrity of the items they repair is remarkable. Their intragate inspection of the exact repair needed made me feel very confident with their quality of workmanship and business integrity.

name: derrick Wright
text: They're the best around, very professional!!

name: Teresa Kelley
text: My husband was very pleased with this place and their service.

name: Karan Bhadane
text: Had my luggage bag's chain fixed here. It was a holiday season around Thanksgiving but they worked really fast and had my bag ready within 3 days. The lady did a awesome job. I will definitely recommend People's Shoe Renewal.

name: George Gaiter
text: Couldn't ever catch it open

name: Leslie A Thomas
text: Took a bit, only show repair in town I'm aware of though.  Not expensive and my shoe is repaired!  Very pleased and do recommend!

name: Tanika Duncan
text: They were fast and courteous.  And the price was very reasonable.

name: Tim Poole
text: I had a pair of uniform boots that I purchased about 15 years ago.  The foot of the boot was in excellent condition but the sole had deteriorated.  I took the boots to them and they replaced the sole with a Vibram sole.  I very much pleased with the work and the look.  I will post later as to the durability but as of right now I am very much pleased.  Customer service was A+ and the cost, not really sure about it as in the fact have nothing else to compare it to, but I felt it was reasonable.

name: Diane Gladden
text: Great job, leather repair on purse, very friendly and helpful

name: Janie Missouri
text: Loved repaired my shoes in a timely Fashion

name: King Craig
text: Family business,  always great service

name: Carter Boyle
text: Fantastic service and quality handiwork!

name: Leshawn Banks
text: They do a very good job at what they do

name: Sharon Long Green
text: I thin they're closed down

name: Eva Harris
text: Ideal place to take your shoes for repairs.

name: Brent
text: I highly recommend this business and service offered.

name: Rodrecus Gay
text: Their service was prompt, friendly, helpful and professional.

name: Valarie Deloach
text: Great service and quality repairs

name: Deborah Williams
text: They are the best at renewing and saving soles!

name: John DeLoach
text: Customer service and the work was great

name: Doreen Richardson
text: Good professional service

name: Theresa Jones
text: Excellent workmanship and service.

name: Shirley Collins
text: I did not have a good experience there.

name: Ernest Co.
text: Takes to long to get back your shoes

name: Stephen Dethrage
text: Completely restored a pair of boots I was ready to throw away, and for a fraction of the price of replacing them.

name: Sherice Cotton
text: Nice friendly people.

name: ramona soper
text: Beautiful job

name: Sommer Link
text:
I will definitely go back for any shoe or bag repair. He did exactly what he said he would for the price he quoted, in the time frame, and fixed my favorite bag.
It is like new again.
Thank you!!!!

name: Accurate Tax Services
text: Mr Vito is very humble, kind and considerate store owner. My shoes was completed hours ahead of expected time. Very impressed and can’t wait to do business with him again! Dee ❤️

name: K Franklin
text:
Took two pairs of cowboy boots to be re-soled. Dropped them off around 3 on Thursday and he texted at noon on Friday they were done. They look and feel great. As good as they were when they were new. So glad to have them to wear again. He is very polite and professional.
Note: he does not have a credit card machine.

name: Michael Dues
text: Vito the business owner was very courteous, professional and efficient with excellent work. Warm and genuine greetings and respectable business man.

name: Bobby Dickey
text: The owner is very kind, honest,  professional and his costs are very reasonable...I recommend this business to everyone

name: Don Wren
text: This guy is a master with leather alterations & repairs. My wife has been there many times to have work done on several purses. She has always been pleased with his work. Give him a try!

name: Bryan Taylor
text: The best customer service and fast turnaround time for replacement soles.

name: Mike Curtin
text: Quality work, honesty...reasonably priced services...its like businesses were run,40 + years ago

name: Mary Conner
text: I have taken my boots, purses and now my dog basket the owner is fast, cheap prices. Does a great job.recommend this place.

name: Sue Rachielles
text: Great job.

name: valarie mcclellan
text: Professional & courteous service. Fair prices for all my shoe shine/repair needs.  Thx CSR

name: Nataleigh Goff
text: Non responsive, and excessively time consuming. They STILL have our shoes..... Two months after dropping them off. Have had to stand on top of owner for updates.

name: BJ Thoughts & Suggestions
text: Greaty, friendly, and fast service.

name: Brandon McCray
text: The best place to get any kind of show repair.  Such a good feeling walking in the doors.

name: april Roberson
text: Great place to take your shoes for repair or stretching etc. I bought a pair of expensive Timberland boots online and they were a little tight and he fixed me up. I HIGHLY recommend this place. You don't find this type of service often anymore.

name: Julie Williams
text: He owns and works alone excellent work very reasonable prices.

name: Michael Kidd
text: Good service and good work.

name: Stephen Barker
text: The absolute best cobbler. Timely shoe repair

name: Pa'ketha Mosley
text: Great work ...and affordable

name: Jerry Brown
text: They did a great job with my ostrich skin boots re-soled and new heels at a much better price than replacing the boots and they didn't have to be broken in

name: Sandra Joseph
text: Awesome work!!🎯🎯

name: Octavia Kuransky
text: Fast service. Clean work. Exactly what I asked for.

name: A. Vines
text: Went in to have some heels taken down and thought I was gonna have to leave them but he did it in less than 10 minutes. I would definitely recommend.

name: JULIA BELL
text: Ran by a very nice gentle, Mr Vito. First time there, job was completed the next day as promised. Fair pricing!

name: David Turner
text: I have had Mr. Vito do several repairs and modifications to belts, shoes and boots. He always has a smile and delivers on time, everytime.

name: Bernard Nobles
text: Good service and fast repair.

name: Charles Dougherty
text: Quick, fast and dependable.

name: Tom Self
text: Great job , good man

name: OG Fitty
text: Went here to replace the zipper that broke off my bag, and the man there had it fixed in an hour... The way he fixed it, its like the bag was never broken.. Go to them, they get the job done..

name: Patrick Rhodes
text: Always helpful

name: Abel Sharpe
text: Nice

name: Garland Shorter
text: Quality shoe repair at a good price

name: Tammy Currie
text: Great service

name: Mark Duncan
text: Replaced the zipper in a leather Motorcycle Boot for me. Had it ready for pick up the next day.

name: Chloe Lemay (m1necraft 5avage)
text: I cannot recommend him enough! I brought in my ariat tall boots to widen the calf. I asked about stretching the leather, he was very honest and said that stretching wouldn’t work. He said that I could put a leather strip behind the zipper. He asked me to take some time to think about it, Which I did. I came back a couple hours later and asked him to do it. It did take him a while to get the boots ready, you can tell when you walk in that he’s very busy. I waited about 3-4 weeks for the boots. But boy was it work the wait, he did a fantastic job! The boot fits my calf perfectly, curve and all. And it’s look amazing, it doesn’t look like he just stuck a random piece of black leather on the boot. It looks like the boot was manufactured like that. All of this to say, Take your shoes here!

name: keita stephens
text: Very nice brother good at what he does go see him for shoe repair watches and etc.

name: Robin Szychulski
text: I took a pair of boots to him because Kim’s in Columbus said she couldn’t fix them without replacing the soles ( the soles are almost new because here in GA you don’t get to wear boots enough to ruin the soles). The toe on both needed to be reglued to the soles. He fixed them and they look brand new! And his prices are extremely reasonable too! I couldn’t be happier.

name: Charlie Vick
text: Excellent job on redoing the soles on my Stetsons.  Highly recommend them.

name: Ana Grinberg
text: This is one of the best shoe repair places I've ever been to. The new owner is really careful on the work he does, really conscientious. He has become the best friend of my shoes (which I love). ALSO, watch repair... the only one in Opelika!

name: Nick Wheeles
text: I brought a pair of Dan Post pythons boots to railroad shoe repair to have them stretched because my toes were cramped.  He had them for a week and when I tried them on they felt like totally different boots.  Night and day improvement.  No scales were damaged during the stretching process and his prices are more than fair.  Would highly recommend and will use his services again when the time comes. 👍🏼👍🏼

name: Bernadette Parsons
text: I brought my shoes in today and he was really sweet and helped me understand what had happened to them. I had a bunch of questions and he was very patient and understanding!

name: Sven Brown
text: Best boot repair ever! Just dropped my boots off came back better shined than I can get them myself and the sole was better than when I bought them. Also still has the hand done look on bottom gives it a real persons touch to my boots .

name: Elizabeth Bostic
text: Great service! I had walked the heels right off of my boots. The new heels look better than new! Saved me from buying new leather boots!

name: J. Finkhousen
text: Took my $150 Cole Haan dress shoes just to have polished. They ruined them!! It looked as if they spray painted them.

name: Alana Stewart
text: I broke one of my shoes that I was planning to wear for graduation while I was taking pictures two days before I was supposed to graduate. I took my shoes in and they were fixed within an hour! I dont have to buy new shoes and the man was very very nice. Also he did an amazing job fixing them. THANK YOU!!!!!

name: Debbie Campbell
text: I turned in two pairs of boots to have the shaft shortened. I didn’t recognize the person working, as I think there are new owners. The previous owner did a wonderful job. This person kept my boots for over two weeks without calling to let me know they were ready, and when I called to see if they were ready, I was told he forgot what I wanted done- despite the direction he previously wrote down were attached to my boots. Then, I noticed there were stains on one pair, so I asked him to clean the stains. His remedy to clean the stains was to use a lint roller. I do NOT recommend this place at all.

name: Isaac Chun
text: Just three words.....Excellent! Execellent! EXCELLENT!

name: Parker Heideman
text: Solid work

name: Patrick Baggett
text: dedicated artisan of a forgotten craft.
